Name: acquisition_instrument_model
Description: Manufacturers of an acquisition instrument may offer various versions (models) of that instrument with different features or sensitivities. Differences in features or sensitivities may be relevant to processing or interpretation of the data.

Name: acquisition_instrument_vendor
Description: An acquisition instrument is the device that contains the signal detection hardware and signal processing software. Assays generate signals such as light of various intensities or color or signals representing the molecular mass.

Name: assay_type
Description: The UMI sequence length in the 10xGenomics-v2 kit is 10 base pairs and the length in the 10xGenomics-v3 kit is 12 base pairs.

Name: cell_barcode_offset
Description: Position(s) in the read at which the cell barcode starts.

Name: cell_barcode_read
Description: Which read file(s) contains the cell barcode. Multiple cell_barcode_read files must be provided as a comma-delimited list (e.g. file1,file2,file3).

Name: cell_barcode_size
Description: Length of the cell barcode in base pairs

Name: contributors_path
Description: Relative path to file with ORCID IDs for contributors for this dataset.

Name: data_path
Description: Relative path to file or directory with instrument data. Downstream processing will depend on filename extension conventions.

Name: description
Description: Free-text description of this assay.

Name: donor_id
Description: HuBMAP Display ID of the donor of the assayed tissue.

Name: execution_datetime
Description: Start date and time of assay, typically a date-time stamped folder generated by the acquisition instrument. YYYY-MM-DD hh:mm, where YYYY is the year, MM is the month with leading 0s, and DD is the day with leading 0s, hh is the hour with leading zeros, mm are the minutes with leading zeros.

Name: expected_cell_count
Description: How many cells are expected? This may be used in downstream pipelines to guide selection of cell barcodes or segmentation parameters.

Name: is_targeted
Description: Specifies whether or not a specific molecule(s) is/are targeted for detection/measurement by the assay.

Name: is_technical_replicate
Description: Is the sequencing reaction run in replicate, TRUE or FALSE

Name: library_adapter_sequence
Description: Adapter sequence to be used for adapter trimming

Name: library_average_fragment_size
Description: Average size in basepairs (bp) of sequencing library fragments estimated via gel electrophoresis or bioanalyzer/tapestation.

Name: library_construction_protocols_io_doi
Description: A link to the protocol document containing the library construction method (including version) that was used, e.g. "Smart-Seq2", "Drop-Seq", "10X v3".

Name: library_final_yield_unit
Description: Units of final library yield

Name: library_final_yield_value
Description: Total number of ng of library after final pcr amplification step. This is the concentration (ng/ul) * volume (ul)

Name: library_id
Description: A library ID, unique within a TMC, which allows corresponding RNA and chromatin accessibility datasets to be linked.

Name: library_layout
Description: State whether the library was generated for single-end or paired end sequencing.

Name: library_pcr_cycles
Description: Number of PCR cycles to amplify cDNA

Name: library_pcr_cycles_for_sample_index
Description: Number of PCR cycles performed for library indexing

Name: operator
Description: Name of the person responsible for executing the assay.

Name: operator_email
Description: Email address for the operator.

Name: pi
Description: Name of the principal investigator responsible for the data.

Name: pi_email
Description: Email address for the principal investigator.

Name: protocols_io_doi
Description: DOI for protocols.io referring to the protocol for this assay.

Name: rnaseq_assay_input
Description: Number of cell/nuclei input to the assay

Name: rnaseq_assay_method
Description: The kit used for the RNA sequencing assay

Name: sc_isolation_cell_number
Description: Total number of cell/nuclei yielded post dissociation and enrichment

Name: sc_isolation_enrichment
Description: The method by which specific cell populations are sorted or enriched.

Name: sc_isolation_entity
Description: The type of single cell entity derived from isolation protocol

Name: sc_isolation_protocols_io_doi
Description: Link to a protocols document answering the question: How were single cells separated into a single-cell suspension?

Name: sc_isolation_quality_metric
Description: A quality metric by visual inspection prior to cell lysis or defined by known parameters such as wells with several cells or no cells. This can be captured at a high level.

Name: sc_isolation_tissue_dissociation
Description: The method by which tissues are dissociated into single cells in suspension.

Name: sequencing_phix_percent
Description: Percent PhiX loaded to the run

Name: sequencing_read_format
Description: Slash-delimited list of the number of sequencing cycles for, for example, Read1, i7 index, i5 index, and Read2.

Name: sequencing_read_percent_q30
Description: Q30 is the weighted average of all the reads (e.g. # bases UMI * q30 UMI + # bases R2 * q30 R2 + ...)

Name: sequencing_reagent_kit
Description: Reagent kit used for sequencing

Name: tissue_id
Description: HuBMAP Display ID of the assayed tissue.

Name: umi_offset
Description: Position in the read at which the umi barcode starts.

Name: umi_read
Description: Which read file(s) contains the UMI (unique molecular identifier) barcode.

Name: umi_size
Description: Length of the umi barcode in base pairs.

Name: version
Description: Version of the schema to use when validating this metadata.
